intro: Chromolaena luquensis, commonly known as the Pacific chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges and often have a hairy texture. Chromolaena luquensis is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in coastal and disturbed environments.
